item.title: Roblox: Mighty Omega Codes (September 2024)
item.description:
Since Mighty Omega is based on the Kengan Ashura anime, players will have to fight each other using different fighting styles. But at first, your character will not even have enough muscles for battles, so you will need a lot of training. To speed up this process, we recommend you use Mighty Omega codes.

Each of them can offer players useful rewards, including currencies such as MC. With their help, you can purchase crates and progress faster in this Roblox experience.

All Mighty Omega Codes

Working Mighty Omega Codes

  • dodomusicparty - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • latnasaga - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • agoodfightingspirit - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • thefool - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • wroughtironhero - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • theemperor - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • anniversary2024over - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • slragnarok - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • bobsledsgift - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • yetanothermccode - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • bonsoiritsagoodnight - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • thegreatestboxer - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • hehasfinallygottenkoei - Redeem this code to get rewards.
  • tunamayo - Redeem this code to get rewards.

Expired Mighty Omega Codes

  • aprilfools2024
  • shiptheseus211
  • compensationforbugs1
  • yolove03112024
  • 50kmembers
  • moanniversary2024code2
  • streetfighterxmo3
  • b1
  • update2024
  • yolove04222024
  • scadutree
  • yolove0410
  • yolove05042024
  • tandarrowauctionsoon
  • thisismyrequiem1111111111111
  • onimisathegoatdeadend
  • requiem101
  • streetfighterxmo2
  • update011024
  • lny2024
  • moanniversary2024
  • 28d24mwl80d36m
  • eeveeloveeeveryone
  • valentine2024
  • delay0224
  • streetfighterxmo
  • v4mpd1ary501
  • yolove01242024
  • overheaven

To win battles in Mighty Omega , players must not only learn martial arts but also unlock special skills. However, this is much more difficult than it seems, since you need to train a lot to meet the requirements and also earn money. Fortunately, there is a way to save a little time and get currencies in just a couple of clicks. All you have to do for this is to use Mighty Omega codes.

By using them, you will receive many valuable rewards, including MC, AC, Cash, and others. However, the validity period of each code is limited. Therefore, players must redeem codes as quickly as possible.

How to Redeem Mighty Omega Codes

Using Mighty Omega codes can be a little confusing for players since the button you need is hidden. In addition, to redeem codes, players must have 30 Total Power or higher. However, following these steps, you will easily get rewards.

  • First, launch Mighty Omega .
  • Then, create your character, if you haven't done so yet, and spawn on the map.
  • After that, scroll down the menu on the left side of the screen and click on the Codes button.
  • Finally, enter the code and click the Redeem button to get free goodies.

How to Get More Mighty Omega Codes

With the help of these Roblox codes, it will be much easier for you to become the strongest fighter on the server. Therefore, we recommend that you visit the developer's social media page. There, you will find news about upcoming updates and new codes first-hand:

  • Mighty Omega Discord server

item.title: Deadlock: Best Wraith Build
item.description:
Wraith is one of the best gankers and split-pushers in Deadlock , and it's all thanks to her kit that lets her quickly take opponents out and disappear before things get too hairy. She's a fairly simple hero to play as, but to get the most out of her, players will want to use the best items available.

The following is a fairly standard Wraith build guide that focuses on improving her 1v1 potential against Deadlock's other heroes while also letting her scale well into the late game as a Gun-based hypercarry.

Best Wraith Items In Deadlock

Wraith relies on both Gun and Spirit damage in order to deal the most DPS possible. However, her kit mostly skews towards the former. As such, this build aims to take advantage of both damage types by making use of Spirit items early on and transitioning into a Gun-heavy build for the mid-late game.

Lane Items

Weapon

  • Basic Magazine

Vitality

  • Extra Regen
  • Healing Rite (If losing lane)

Spirit

  • Extra Charge
  • Mystic Burst
  • Infuser

Take Basic Magazine first to help you poke and last hit minions. Players should almost always focus on farming Souls in Deadlock — unless you're getting bullied in lane, try to buy an offensive item first. Otherwise, get Extra Regen or Healing Rite for extra lane sustain.

Extra Charge, Mystic Burst, and Infuser are here to help you bully your lane opponent away and possibly secure some kills. Buy these after Basic Magazine, or get Mystic Burst first if you want to go all-in on aggression. Once you get two or three stacks of Card Trick, pop Infuser, and throw all your cards at the enemy to blow them up.

Core Items

Weapon

  • Slowing Bullets
  • Tesla Bullets
  • Lucky Shot
  • Burst Fire

Vitality

  • Combat Barrier
  • Spirit Armor
  • Bullet Lifesteal

Spirit

  • Quicksilver Reload

These are the items players should aim to get as soon as possible when playing Wraith. These allow for significantly improved damage output, better AOE damage via Tesla Bullets, and instant reloads thanks to Quicksilver Reload.

Combining the rate of fire buffs from Burst Fire, Combat Barrier, and Wraith's Full Auto skill maximizes the amount of bullets players can pump into an enemy while they're suspended by Wraith's Ultimate, Telekinesis. This makes her similar to Deadlock's Haze, who capitalizes on her fast-firing weapons to secure kills.

Purchase priority is top to bottom, but if you feel like you need the extra survivability, feel free to buy Vitality items first. Sell the laning items one by one as you get enough Souls to get your Core items.

Players can keep Mystic Burst and Infuser as slot fillers until they can get better Spirit items. Additionally, if you're struggling with Souls, postpone Lucky Shot for Intensifying Magazine.

Situational Items and Flex Slots

The items you buy for your vacant and Flex slots all depend on how well the game is going . Here are some recommended flex items for Wraith and the situations players should buy them in:

  • Toxic Bullets: Causes bullets to apply a Bleeding effect that inflicts damage over time, as well as Healing Reduction. Buy this when the enemy has strong healing capabilities.
  • Leech: Great item to buy when you need more lifesteal.
  • Mystic Slow: If Slowing Bullets isn't enough to help you hit your shots. Effect will trigger with Tesla Bullet procs.
  • Inhibitor: Bullets will slow enemies hit and reduce their outgoing damage. Stacks with Mystic Slow and Slowing Bullets.
  • Titanic Magazine: Increases your ammo by 100% along with small improvements for Weapon Damage and Bullet Resist. Buy if Quicksilver Reload isn't enough to sustain your ammo in a fight.
  • Intensifying Magazine: Deal more damage as you fire your weapon. Synergizes well with Wraith's kit. Buy this over Slowing Bullets if necessary.
  • Curse: Silences, Interrupts, Disarms, and prevents enemies from using items for 3 seconds. Buy to counter the most-fed enemy on the other team.
  • Extra Stamina: Used for spamming dodge. Good if the enemy has a lot of skillshots.
  • Suppressor: Reduces the fire rate of enemies hit by your Spirit Damage. Great for countering fast attackers like Infernus and Haze.

Wraith Skill Priorities

  1. Card Trick - 1 point
  2. Full Auto - 3 points
  3. Telekinesis - 1 point
  4. Max Project Mind
  5. Max Telekinesis
  6. Max Full Auto
  7. Max Card Trick

For this build, put one point into Card Trick first to get three cards during the laning phase with Extra Charge. Then, upgrade Full Auto twice so it gets a shorter cooldown and a bonus effect that makes it deal Spirit damage. Then, put one point into Telekinesis to reduce its cooldown.

Afterward, max Project Mind first so you can always have an exit strategy for when things get dicey. Its second upgrade also gives you a Bullet Shield, which you can take advantage of when fighting other Deadlock heroes using max Weapon Damage builds.

item.title: Funko Fusion: Hands On With All of the New Pops! [Massive Gallery]
item.description:
Developed by 10:10 Games, Funko Fusion isn’t the popular, big-eyed collectible brand’s first foray into the world of video games, but it is no doubt its biggest. Masters of the Universe , Jurassic World , Five Nights at Freddy’s , and more – there is a lot for fans to dig into in this game.

But while the focus has mostly on how the developers can successfully combine their experience adapting popular licenses to the interactive medium and the Funko personality, no one has forgotten about why many fans are drawn to the game in the first place. Funko Pops! are the bread and butter, and Funko Fusion will have its own line to support the upcoming game.

We got hands on the complete Wave 1 of Funko Fusion Pops to see them up close and personal. Funko has delivered a wide swath of characters for this (presumably) first run of Pops, while also leveraging some of its different design styles as well. It’s a perfect snapshot of the type of mash-up that Funko Fusion aims to provide.

Funko Fusion Pops Include Chase Variants and Codes

In true Funko Pop! tradition, there are a few special surprises for the Funko Fusion collectibles. Some Pops have a 1-in-6 Chase Variant that has been Eddi-fied - corrupted by the villainous Eddy Funko from the game. As Chase Variants, these Pops have a different color scheme and some design changes.

Alongside the Chase Variants, the Funko Fusion Pops come with a redeemable code for an in-game item. The redemption site is not live yet, so we don’t know what item is included with each Pop but you have to assume they tie in to that character’s property.

Cylon from Battlestar Galactica (Funko Pop! #998)

The original Battlestar Galactica Cylons are among the most iconic sci-fi creations. These Pops capture the spirit of the Cylons’ battle to eradicate humanity, with a tiny Funko skull under the right boot. There is a Chase Variant version of the Funko Fusion Cylon Pop as well, which has been Eddi-fied with the pinkish color scheme and the veins coming from its visor and chest plate.

Shaun from Shaun of the Dead (Funko Pop! #996)

Simon Pegg gets two different Pops based on characters from his popular Edgar Wright collaborations. First up is Shaun from Shaun of the Dead , sporting his signature white shirt, red tie, and nametag combo along with a bloody cricket bat. The Funko Fusion Pop has a fun little, twisted toe pose so it comes with a clear base to make sure it stands up properly.

Nicholas Angel from Hot Fuzz (Funko Pop! #997)

The other Simon Pegg character getting the Funko Fusion Pop treatment is Nicholas Angel from Hot Fuzz . This Pop is equipped with the full arsenal seen briefly towards the end of the film and comes with a stand to keep him suspended mid-dive with guns drawn. If only he could shoot his guns in the air and scream “Aaaaah.”

He-Man from Masters of the Universe (Funko Pop! #1006)

10:10 Games’ Arthur Parsons cited Masters of the Universe as one of the properties he was most excited to work with on Funko Fusion , so it only makes sense that He-Man get a Pop!. With Power Sword drawn and some cool lightning effects coming off it, the He-Man Pop looks plenty cool. It also has an Eddi-fied Chase Variant that once again has a purple color scheme and corrupted eyes.

M3GAN from M3GAN (Funko Pop! #1001)

If there was any doubt that Funko Fusion is a potpourri of Universal properties, the M3GAN Pop is proof that this game dug deep. For this collectible, Funko has chosen the version of M3GAN that has already gone a little haywire, is beginning to show her internal components, and is out for blood. She starts off a little more palatable in the game, but here her motivations have been revealed.

R.J. Macready from The Thing (Funko Pop! #993)

Macready from The Thing is a character you might not expect to see as a Funko Pop or in Funko Fusion , but it’s a really cool addition regardless. He’s got the classic flamethrower with a little translucent flame on the tip, and the classic Antarctica get-up on.

Spider Head from The Thing (Funko Pop! #994)

In fact, The Thing is getting a lot of love in this first run of Funko Fusion Pops. There is also the Spider Head available, which is easily one of the more disturbing Pops that Funko has ever made. That being said, they didn’t skimp on the design and brought a lot of detail to what is an otherwise grotesque character.

The Blair Monster from The Thing (Funko Pop! #995)

But wait, there’s more. If the Spider Head wasn’t disturbing enough, The Blair Monster is also part of the Funko Fusion Pop first wave. A Deluxe Funko Pop!, this one is bigger than most in Wave 1 and is just as creepy as you might expect. I’m surprised by how much love that The Thing is getting from Funko Fusion , but it is much appreciated.

Indominus Rex from Jurassic World (Funko Pop! #1005)

You don’t link up with Universal and not consider Jurassic World , and Funko Fusion has included the Indominus Rex from the Chris Pratt-led films. Funnily enough, this is the first Indominus Rex Pop that Funko has done, and it’s a stunner. It’s slightly bigger than most of the standard Pops and comes with a stand to keep it upright in that stalking pose. The Pop also has a Chase Variant that has a purple color scheme and corrupted eyes.

Scare Mare and Scare Glow from Masters of the Universe (Funko Pop! #999)

I mentioned the love for Masters of the Universe , so it’s not surprising that Funko got two separate Pops in. Scare Mare and Scare Glow are a perfect choice for a Pop Rides combo, since Funko’s Mondo brand actually created Scare Mare for its MOTU Vinyl line. This is just an awesome Pop with tons of detail and fun colors.

Mecha Freddy (Funko Fusion Pop! #1004)

Now we are getting into the Funko universe side of Funko Fusion . Mecha Freddy is a Mech version of Freddy Funko, the brand’s iconic mascot. You knew that Freddy was going to make at least one appearance in the game and as a Pop and this is a great design for the character. The way Funko blends Freddy with other styles and brands is so inventive and Mecha Freddy is no exception.

Cosmic Freddy (Funko Fusion Pop! #1013)

Cosmic Freddy has a little more of the traditional Freddy Funko look, but its the material that makes him standout. A little translucent green and a little translucent blue, the Funko Fusion Pop is beautiful to look at, without even knowing about the game.

Eddy Funko (Funko Fusion Pop! #1010)

And it wouldn’t be a Funko Fusion Pop set without the big bad: Eddy Funko. Designed as the antithesis of Freddy Funko, Eddy is a perfect foil for this video game adaptation and his Pop is pretty great as well. You can see where the purple color scheme comes from and the corrupted eye design. There’s also a little storytelling done with the goop in Eddy’s hands.

With Five Nights at Freddy’s , Scott Pilgrim , and more included in the Funko Fusion roster of characters, this first run is presumably just the tip of the iceberg. But what Funko has done in its collaboration with 10:10 Games is a really diverse and cool looking first wave of Pops. It comes full circle in spectacular fashion.

item.title: Why Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom's Tri Rod Likely Isn't a Master Sword Equivalent
item.description:
The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom is deeply rooted in the spirit of the franchise, especially considering its most recent games. In no small part, Zelda games are about innovation, and The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom offers the perfect tools to explore what's really possible. However, the Tri Rod certainly doesn't seem to be cut from the same cloth as its iconic counterpart.

The Master Sword is undoubtedly one of the most iconic weapons in gaming history, it may even take the number one spot. Likewise, the Tri Rod seems to be Zelda's signature weapon in Echoes of Wisdom . Despite this, it's unlikely that the Tri Rod will manage to reach the iconic status of the Master Sword, or even attempt to.

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom's Tri Rod Has Big Shoes to Fill

The Master Sword's Role in The Legend of Zelda

The Legend of Zelda has a rich history that is still deeply respected by its most recent games. Although the Switch era of the series may seem like a wild departure, they were still largely informed by the same principles that made the very first game special. After all, innovation in Zelda is led first and foremost by its identity as a grand fantasy adventure.

Of course, no fantasy setting could be complete without a legendary weapon. As far as mythical weapons go, the Master Sword has always been at the forefront of gaming. Not only is it a crucial piece of Zelda iconography rivaled only by the Triforce, but it is often essential within the lore of each game as well.

In short, the Master Sword is much more than a simple weapon. It is often the only weapon that can defeat evil as powerful as Ganondorf, and obtaining it is often one of the most important objectives in the game. While it may have left other aspects of Zelda lore in the dust, Tears of the Kingdom kept the Master Sword front and center, with Link reclaiming it serving as the emotional high point of the story.

The Tri Rod May Be Just Another Gimmick

By comparison, the Tri Rod in Echoes of Wisdom just doesn't seem to carry the same weight. First and foremost, the game will likely have a slightly lighter narrative than most 3D Zelda games. Echoes of Wisdom is visually inspired by the recent remake of Link's Awakening , and while the latter still has emotional moments, there simply isn't as much time dedicated towards any sort of plot.

This isn't the only thing standing in the way of Tri Rod. Echoes of Wisdom has shown off a unique style of gameplay, and though it again seems like a departure on its face, it still shares the same priorities the series has always had. While the Echoes Zelda creates with the Tri Rod may be a perfect fit for her first playable outing, it's hard to imagine them making a return in any other setting or circumstance.

Zelda Already Had a Signature Weapon Before Echoes of Wisdom

Most importantly, Zelda already has a number of iconic weapons that she used long before the Tri Rod. Zelda is often a powerful mage above all else, so it's no wonder she would wield a magical staff in a game like Echoes of Wisdom . However, Zelda has historically been depicted using Arrows of Light, even providing Link with the Bow of Light as recently as Breath of the Wild . With that in mind, it's easy to assume Zelda may return to her more iconic weapon in any future titles.

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom is the first time Zelda will headline a game as a playable heroine, and it hopefully won't be the last. While the Tri Rod perfectly matches the vision of the game, it likely wouldn't transfer to other games so easily. While it seems certain to be tons of fun, the Tri Rod doesn't seem likely to come back in the future, making it remarkably different from the Master Sword.

item.title: Roblox: Sword Factory GUI Codes (September 2024)
item.description:
Sword Factory GUI is an idle Roblox game in which, as the name implies, you will create swords. The gameplay is very simple and repetitive. You will mostly just watch as the swords get different features. Then, you will sell them and for the money received, you will be able to increase the chances of forging a quality sword. In addition, you can redeem Sword Factory GUI codes to get some boosters and in-game currency.

All Sword Factory GUI Codes

Working Sword Factory GUI Codes

  • Loading - Enter this code to get 10,000 Gems.
  • Gems - Enter this code to get 10,000 Gems.
  • Update1 - Enter this code to get 20,000 Gems.
  • FreeBoosts - Enter this code to get 3 Money Boosts & 3 EXP Boosts.
  • Enchant - Enter this code to get 10,000 Gems.
  • Update2 - Enter this code to get 10,000 Gems.
  • ThanksForTheSupport - Enter this code to get 15,000 Gems.
  • Lucky - Enter this code to get 2 2x Luck and 2 3x Luck Boosts.
  • Release - Enter this code to get 5,000 Gems.

Expired Sword Factory GUI Codes

So far, there are no expired codes in Sword Factory GUI .

How to Redeem Codes in Sword Factory GUI

The interface in Sword Factory GUI may seem a bit more complicated than in other Roblox games. However, it is still easy to redeem codes here, as you just need to find the settings. If you need help with this, you can simply use our guide below:

  • Open Roblox and launch Sword Factory GUI .
  • Press Play.
  • Find the gray Menu button in the bottom-left corner of the screen.
  • Go to the Settings tab.
  • Look for the blue box. Paste the code from the list of working codes into it and press the green Enter button.

Keep in mind that codes may expire over time. Therefore, redeem them as soon as possible to get rewards.

How to Get More Sword Factory GUI Codes

Sometimes, you can find Roblox codes in the game or on the game's page, but this is rare. Usually, you have to search the developers' social media or various websites to find codes, and they've often expired. However, if you are here, you are lucky because we regularly update our guides and add new working codes to them. In order not to miss the freebies, we recommend that you bookmark this guide in your browser with the key combination Ctrl + D. But if you are more interested in the developer social networks, you can follow the links below:

  • Sword Factory GUI X page
  • Sword Factory GUI Discord server
  • Sword Factory GUI Roblox group
